P009712.project_name: Agricultural Refinance and Development Corporation Credit Project (02)

keywords.cdata: ADB,Agricultural Banking,Agricultural Credit,agricultural extension,agricultural investments,agricultural production,Agriculture,Agriculture Projects,bad debts,Balance Sheets,bank lending,Bank Management,banking structure,Borrowing,breeding,cattle,Coconut,Commercial Banks,competitiveness,cooperative banking,Cooperative Banks,CROPPING,CROPPING SEASONS,Crops,current prices,deposits,Development Agencies,Development Banks,Economic Analysis,Economic Rate of Return,employment,exchange rate,exploitation,exports,Farmers,farms,FISCAL YEAR,fish,fisheries,Fishing,foreign exchange,forestry,GNP,Growth Rate,HYV,imports,Income,Index Numbers,Insurance,Interest Rate,Interest Rates,irri,Irrigation,Land Development,land productivity,laws,legislation,lending institutions,Lending Rates,livestock,mortgages,operating costs,operating expenditures,per capita income,Poultry,price increases,Productivity,Regional Rural Banks,Reserve Bank of India,Resources Mobilization,sheep,soil resources,soils,Subsidiary,Water Resources,water supply

project_abstract.cdata: The purpose of the project is to support a two-year ARDC program of lending to farmers and an intensive training effort primarily for the staff of land development banks (LDB). Lending under the project would be mainly for minor irrigation, but credit for development of other on-farm activities such as dairying, poultry raising, and sericulture would be provided.
